page.title: 12HUTTON ESTATE-HOUSE OPENING
page.content: Hutton-in-the-Forest, Lord Inglewood's historic home, is open to the public in a low-key manner from May - September every Thursday, Friday and Sunday; parties can come any day by prior arrangement, and the grounds may be visited any daytime. The business is under the day to day control of Mrs. R. Blake. Nine rooms inside are open, which contain a wide range of furnishings well looked after by Mrs. J. Grant. On most days there are guided tours every 20 minutes, and on Bank Holidays each each room has an attendant. There is a tea room in the Cloisters under the Gallery. A number of local events are presented at the House. It is planned to increase visitor numbers from 5000 in 1984 towards 15000, without changing the place's atmosphere.
